Detailed Description

Allows to do text operations on a multimedia editor document in an easy manner. Using this class is not mandatory, as the multimedia editor itself offers all possibilities for text operations too. But the offered methods from the class MultiMediaEditorDocument are very generic and not specialized for text operations. By using the TextManager it is very easy to e. g. underline the whole text inside the document although several images might be embedded already: 
MultiMediaEditorDocument::TextManager text_man(doc);
text_man.SetTextAttr(0, doc->GetItemCount(), TextFormat::Underlined);

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MultiMediaEditorDocument::TextManager::TextManager (  MultiMediaEditorDocument &  doc  ) 
 

Constructs the text manager which operates on the document doc. If the text manager operates on a document which is already opened by an editor, don't forget to invoke Editor::Update() after the modification.

MultiMediaEditorDocument::TextManager::~TextManager (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN MultiMediaEditorDocument::TextManager::InsertText (  const WString &  text,
INT  item_index = -1,
TextAttr  attr = TextFormat::Normal,
const Font *  font = 0,
const Color *  foreground_color = 0,
const Color *  background_color = 0
) 
 

Inserts a text at the given item index.

Parameters:
text Text which should be inserted.
item_index Index of the item where the text should get inserted. If a value < 0 is used, the text will be appended at the end of the document.
text_attr Attribute of the text (Normal, Underlined, Italic, Bold, Strikethrough). Setting two attributes at the same time can be done the following way: TextAttr text_attr = TextFormat::Italic | TextFormat::Bold;
font Pointer to the used font. If a null pointer is passed, the font Font::TextEditor is used per default. The passed font object is a read-only parameter which can be deleted immediately after invoking this method.
foreground_color Background color of the text. If a null-pointer is passed, the background will be transparent. The passed color object is a read-only parameter which can be deleted immediately after invoking this method.
background_color Foreground color of the text. If a null-pointer is passed, the color Color::ClientForeground will be used. The passed color object is a read-only parameter which can be deleted immediately after invoking this method.
Returns:
TRUE if the inserting of the text has been successful.

BOOLEAN MultiMediaEditorDocument::TextManager::SetBackgroundColor (  INT  item_index,
INT  item_count,
const Color &  color
) 
 

Sets the background color of the text for a specified range.

Parameters:
item_index Index of the first item where the background color should be changed.
item_count Number of items where the background color should be changed.
color New background color for the text inside the specified range.
Returns:
TRUE, if the setting of the background color has been successful.

INT  item_count,
const Font &  font
) 
 

Sets the font of the text for a specified range.

Parameters:

item_count Number of items where the font should be changed.

Returns:
TRUE, if the setting of the font has been successful.

BOOLEAN MultiMediaEditorDocument::TextManager::SetTextAttr (  INT  item_index,
INT  item_count,
TextAttr  attr
) 
 

Sets the text attribute of the text for a specified range (Normal, Underlined, Italic, Bold, Strikethrough). Setting two attributes at the same time can be done the following way: TextAttr text_attr = TextFormat::Italic | TextFormat::Bold;

Parameters:
item_index Index of the first item where the text attribute should be changed.
item_count Number of items where the text attribute should be changed.
attr New text attribute for the text inside the specified range.
Returns:
TRUE, if the setting of the text attribute has been successful.
